author: aharon
title: ₳GOV: Policy Registry
description: 虽然代议制民主总是面临着腐败的风险，但让公民参与决策过程是一个巨大的挑战。

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal seeks to solve the problem of lack of citizen involvement in public policy decisions by creating a policy register with democratic editing which partially aligns with the challenge goals but is not a foundational registry solution listed in the challenge. 
The proposal does a good job of articulating how the solution scales to address future challenges and providing key metrics and goals that more closely align with the challenge.
The proposal could be improved by articulating the value to Cardano ecosystem and either selecting another challenge (Miscellaneous) or more closely aligning with this challenge's goals.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal is an excellent example of team composition, 
The proposal articulates the feasibility aspects of evidence of experience (websites), budget is broken down and reasonable (but breakdown does not match the total off by $1K), and detailed technical explanation of the solution.
The proposal's feasibility could be improved by realistic timetable and plan (no timeline for MVP creation just targets afterwards) and a challenges and risks section.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal includes metrics/KPIs to measure proposal success, a clear understandable description of the targeted problem and a detailed description of the solution that addresses the problem.
To improve the proposal include a roadmap, milestones, time horizon for MVP creation.

f6_assessments.q0: This team has other projects that involve their produce Consenz. It seems they want to fund several aspects of their Consenz app, and this proposal fits well with a Nation Building App since voting for democracies is an important cornerstone.
f6_assessments.q1: I do not doubt the team's abilities, but rather the project scope. This is huge!  I know the Atala Prism project is huge, but wonder why this project just does not use and expand upon Atala Prism.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs seem easy enough to track if stats were provided publicly with success being the number of active users and the number of paying agencies.  The "paying agencies" part if why I took off a star: it would seem difficult to obtain these.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about building a web app that can be used for public participation in policy-shaping, from the municipality level to the nation-state level. The problem statement is clear and explained. The proposed solution is clearly defined, addresses the challenge, may contribute to the decision-making process. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly agree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 5
f6_assessments.q1: Consenz team profile is briefly described, and through the provided link [https://www.adagov.org/ ; https://www.soficoop.com/], I can see this team's works and achievements. This team got some funded proposals in the prior fund [F4, F5, F6]. However, for better understanding, the Consenz team profile [from ₳GOV and from Sofi Coop], as well as the member's profile, should be explained more in detail with reference/proof (documents/links,...) for verifying how suitable they are to this proposal. The budget is not provided much information [only total budget and items structure of 05 items but without explanations of calculation base]. The target for 3 months, and 6 months are described enough for understanding, with KPI, but very abstract, can not define if they are measurable or not. Besides, risks are not provided. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provided a wide range of information. However, there is a lack of: (1)The Consenz team profile [from ₳GOV and from Sofi Coop] with reference/proof (documents/links,...) for verifying. I can see that this team's ability, skills are very suitable to implement this proposal with some completed works; so it would be more auditable if team profile, as well as accomplishments, are provided more in detail; (2) Budget: firstly, the budget structure of the 5 items should be clarified more in detail with explanations of calculation base for each item; (3) Risk/challenge (and mitigation/ management) analysis. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 3

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal goes to the very core of the Brief. It is a sound and effective DAO concept. However, it does not speak to the asset creation and property rights issues that the Brief highlights in the De Soto reference.
f6_assessments.q1:
The hebrew version of this concept is up and recieving user feedback. The team is sound and competent, involved in the community, and has a history of delivering quality tools.
The plan is sound and logical.
f6_assessments.q2:
The following milestones are specific, time-fenced, measurable and publically auditable: "Targets for 3 months after MVP lunch:

At least 3 paying agencies/customers
With > 1,000 active user
Targets for 6 months after MVP lunch:

At least 10 paying agencies/customer
With > 5,000 active users"

f6_assessments.q0: A voting tool used by residents across jurisdictions to help shape policymaker decisions is a fantastic way to effectively address the challenge of building solutions for nation states.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has the beta app in use by several groups in Israel to organize around policy decisions, this proposal is to extend the beta app into a production ready application  for the Cardano community members to bring to their regional governments to recommend implementing. The plan includes a project status, KPI and budget section.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the team behind this proposal has already completed a beta app release.
